intro: Cyrtandra oligantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian red ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking red bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with upright, branched stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Cyrtandra oligantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and coastal areas.
